title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Each solution curve must pass through the appropriate point, extend reasonably close to the right edge of the square, and have no obvious conflicts with the given slope lines.

Ignore any portion of a solution curve that extends beyond the square.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

An answer of 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaaaaa@39B6@ earns the point.

The answer of −50 4 ln( 50 50 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@429F@ need not be simplified, but any subsequent simplification must be correct.

Limit notation is not required.

Expressions that equate the limit with the derivative such as lim y→50 dy dx = −y 4 ln( y 50 )= −50 4 ln( 50 50 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@595C@ or other linkage errors, will not earn the point, even in the presence of the correct evaluation.

Expressions with incomplete limit notation, such as lim y→50 = −50 4 ln( 50 50 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4BCC@ are eligible for the point.

The expression lim y→50 −50 4 ln( 50 50 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A16@ is not incorrect, but the limit must be resolved to earn this point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for −5ln( 2 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA0@ or the equivalent; no supporting work is necessary.

The evaluation does not need to be simplified, and incorrect attempts at simplifying a correct expression will not be read.

For the second point to be earned, the response must:

· Argue that dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CD9@ is positive for 0<y<50, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EE5@ thus f MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E7@ is increasing for 0<y<50. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EE7@

· Argue that the particular solution cannot cross the line y=50. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG5bGaeyypa0JaaGynaiaaicdacaGGUaaaaa@3D2B@ (This may be done implicitly by restricting the domain of consideration to 0<y<50 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E35@ .)

Explanations may be graphical but must address both of the above points.

Explanations that appeal only to the sign of f ′  ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DC7@ will not earn this point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned by correctly applying the product rule in finding d 2 y d x 2 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F6E@ with or without using the chain rule. For example, d 2 y d x 2 =− 1 4  ⋅ ln( y 50 )− y 4  ⋅  1 y MathType@MTEF@5@5@@57B7@ would earn the first point.

The second point is earned for correctly applying the chain rule (twice) in finding d 2 y d x 2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F70@ This point can be earned even if an error was made in applying the product rule that resulted in the first point not being earned. In general, expressions of the form d 2 y d x 2 =c ⋅ ln( y 50 ) ⋅  dy dx +g ( y ) ⋅  dy dx , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@658A@ where g ( y ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E00@ may be a nonzero constant and c MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGJbaaaa@39E3@ is a nonzero constant, earn this point.

For the first two points, if both the factors 50 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI1aGaaGimaaaa@3A75@ and 1 50 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaI1aGaaGimaaaaaaa@3B40@ are not present in the response, assume that these factors were canceled. Furthermore, in the presence of the factor 50, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI1aGaaGimaiaacYcaaaa@3B25@ assume that a missing factor 1 50 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaI1aGaaGimaaaaaaa@3B40@ is an error in the application of the chain rule. Thus, d 2 y d x 2 =− 1 4  ⋅  dy dx  ⋅ ln( y 50 )− y 4  ⋅  50 y  ⋅  dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6B45@ would earn the first point but not the second point.

For the first two points, each point is earned with the correct expression and any subsequent errors in simplification come off of the fourth point.

The third point is earned when the declared d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EB4@ is set equal to zero and one initial (correct or otherwise) algebraic step towards solving this equation for y MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG5baaaa@39FA@ is made. However, the declared expression for d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EB4@ must contain the variable y MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG5baaaa@39FA@ and must be distinct from dy dx = −y 4 ln( y 50 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@473E@ (This means a score of 0-0-1-0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD9@ is possible in this part.)

The fourth point cannot be earned without having earned the first three points.

The fourth point requires a discussion of the behavior of d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EB4@ both to the left and right of y=50 e −1 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FF4@

Sign charts, labeled or otherwise, are not read for the fourth point.
